skill.name: market-research-reports
skill.description: Generate comprehensive market research reports (50+ pages) in the style of top consulting firms (McKinsey, BCG, Gartner). Features professional LaTeX formatting, extensive visual generation with scientific-schematics and generate-image, deep integration with research-lookup for data gathering, and multi-framework strategic analysis including Porter's Five Forces, PESTLE, SWOT, TAM/SAM/SOM, and BCG Matrix.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or persistence behavior detected. Subprocess usage only invokes local generator scripts and matches the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: You need credible market research but assembling frameworks, visuals, and structure takes too long. This skill provides templates, visual prompts, and analysis guides to build consulting style reports quickly.
actual_capabilities: Generate 5-6 core visuals with scripted prompts for scientific-schematics and generate-image
Generate an extended set of 27 additional market visuals with the --all option
Provide a LaTeX report template with structured sections and placeholders
Provide a LaTeX style package with colors, boxes, and typography
Provide guides for report structure, data analysis patterns, and visual naming conventions
limitations: Does not fetch market data or sources automatically
Requires external skills scientific-schematics and generate-image to render visuals
Requires a LaTeX toolchain to compile PDF output
Visual generator assumes the skills directory layout for script paths

use_cases.title: Investment market scan
use_cases.description: Build a structured report with market sizing, risks, and competitive landscape for an investment memo.

use_cases.title: Market entry brief
use_cases.description: Create a detailed market overview with TAM SAM SOM, drivers, and recommendations for a launch plan.

use_cases.title: Client industry report
use_cases.description: Generate a consulting style report template with visuals and analysis frameworks for client delivery.

prompt_templates.title: Start a report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a market research report outline for the battery recycling market, using the provided LaTeX template sections.

prompt_templates.title: Generate core visuals
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the core visual set for the smart agriculture market and place outputs in figures/ with the standard naming scheme.

prompt_templates.title: Build analysis section
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft the Market Size and Growth chapter with TAM SAM SOM logic, data tables, and placeholders for sources.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced full pack
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate the full visual set and produce a 50+ page LaTeX report structure for the hydrogen storage market.

output_examples.input: Outline a market research report for the digital therapeutics market
output: Executive summary structure with key metrics placeholders
Chapter list covering market size, trends, and competition
Recommended visuals mapped to each chapter

best_practices: Generate core visuals first to anchor the narrative
Use the formatting guide to keep box styles consistent
Cite sources in every quantitative claim and table
anti_patterns: Skipping the executive summary infographic for long reports
Mixing custom LaTeX styling with the provided style package
Using uncited market sizes in tables or charts

faq.question: Which environments are compatible?
faq.answer: It works with LaTeX toolchains and the scientific-schematics and generate-image skills on supported hosts.

faq.question: What are the output size limits?
faq.answer: The templates target 50+ pages, but actual length depends on your content and data inputs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing data workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, you can paste your data into the LaTeX tables and update visual prompts with your metrics.

faq.question: Does it access my files or secrets?
faq.answer: No, the provided scripts and templates do not read user credentials or transmit data.

faq.question: What if visual generation fails?
faq.answer: Use the verbose flag to inspect errors and rerun specific visuals with the --only filter.

faq.question: How does this compare to a generic report template?
faq.answer: It adds consulting grade visual prompts, analysis frameworks, and a dedicated LaTeX style package.
